sub_topic: Calculate the Gaussian curvature of a surface.
message_1: A sphere with radius 5 cm has a surface area of 314.16 square centimeters. Calculate the Gaussian curvature at any point on the surface of the sphere.
message_2:
The Gaussian curvature (K) of a sphere can be calculated using the formula:

K = 1/R^2

where R is the radius of the sphere.

Given that the radius of the sphere is 5 cm, we can calculate the Gaussian curvature as follows:

K = 1/(5^2)
K = 1/25
K = 0.04

Therefore, the Gaussian curvature at any point on the surface of the sphere is 0.04 (in units of cm^(-2)).
